channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: A major telephoto camera upgrade is rumored for all the Samsung Galaxy S26 models
item.description: We have some more rumored details about what to expect from the Galaxy S26 phones arriving next year.
item.dc:creator: David Nield, TechRadar

item.title: What really happens on the dark web and how to stay safe
item.description: Cybersecurity expert shares six essential steps to protect against dark web threats, including data removal services, password managers and antivirus software.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: So long, Life360: This privacy-minded service is location sharing done right
item.description: When we talk about phones and location sharing, we’re typically talking about limiting how much info overly aggressive apps can access. But there’s another side to location sharing—and that’s actively opting to share your location with specific people (not companies!) for your own personal purposes.
item.dc:creator: JR Raphael, Fast Company

item.title: What is Skylight? Here’s what you need to know about the TikTok alternative
item.description: The current king of social media is the short-form video platform TikTok. It’s where trends are forged, news is broken, and opinions spread.
item.dc:creator: Michael Grothaus, Fast Company

item.title: A supercomputer chip going to space could change life on Earth
item.description: NVIDIA GPU space mission could revolutionize cloud services by enabling orbital data centers that make apps, games and AI tools faster and more efficient.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: ICYMI: the 7 biggest tech stories of the week, from Samsung's tri-fold to a robot for your household chores
item.description: The week's biggest stories from Fitbit, Samsung, OnePlus, Microsoft and a strange humanoid robot called Neo.
item.dc:creator: David Nield, TechRadar

item.title: 6 new Apple TV+ movies and shows to watch in November 2025
item.description: Every new Apple TV+ movie and show being released throughout November 2025 that you need to know about.
item.dc:creator: Amelia Schwanke, TechRadar

item.title: How Apple managed to deliver a strong third quarter despite a global trade war
item.description: Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligence race.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: Amazon’s third-quarter results get a boost from its cloud computing business
item.description: Amazon posted higher fiscal third quarter profit and sales compared with a year ago, fueled by accelerating growth in its cloud computing business and strong spending by its customers looking for low prices at a time when inflation is resurging.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: A new study found a surprising source of social media toxicity
item.description: It’s widely known that social media can quickly turn into a toxic cesspool of hate speech and ragebait, particularly during times of political turmoil. Across social media platforms, amplified by the algorithm, hate often breeds hate.
item.dc:creator: Eve Upton-Clark, Fast Company

item.title: New LinkedIn phishing scam targets executives with fake board positions
item.description: No, you're not being invited to invest in South American businesses, you're being scammed into handing over Microsoft login credentials.
item.dc:creator: Sead Fadilpašić, TechRadar

item.title: I went to the launch of the Prusa Core One L - and the impressive scale of this 3D printer sets a benchmark for the future
item.description: A new era in 3D printing is fast approaching and the latest Core One L refines CoreXY Kinematics to offer a larger print area in box only marginally larger than the original.
item.dc:creator: Alastair Jennings, TechRadar

item.title: ABC, ESPN go dark on YouTube TV amid carrier dispute with Disney
item.description: Disney-owned networks like ABC and ESPN were taken off YouTube TV's channel offerings overnight as the two sides work to reach a new agreement on broadcast rights.
item.dc:creator: Dominick Mastrangelo, The Hill

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and more from YouTube TV as talks break down
item.description: YouTube TV viewers have lost access to Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after contract talks broke down.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Context engineering: Improving AI by moving beyond the prompt
item.description: Organizations deploying AI have focused heavily on prompt engineering as a method for generating the best results, but an emerging technique called context engineering will make AI tools more accurate and useful, experts say.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: In the future, U.S. troops won’t just deploy drones. They’ll make them
item.description: For U.S. soldiers who find themselves at the front lines of a future conflict, it’s fast becoming gospel, due to the way warfare is rapidly evolving on the battlefields of Ukraine, that drones will be crucial to winning (or losing) the fight But the roughly 500 U.S.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Sisson, Fast Company

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligenc
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: AMD to build two more supercomputers at Oak Ridge National Labs
item.description: The collaboration between AMD and the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Facility at the Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL) continues, with two more supercomputers planned to join the two that already are deployed.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Strengthening security with a converged security and networking platform
item.description: Today’s IT environment of multiple clouds, hybrid work, and the exploding popularity of AI has given cybercriminals unprecedented opportunities for launching attacks — and the traditional arsenal of tools organizations use to stop them isn’t working.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: 183 million email passwords leaked: Check yours now
item.description: Cybersecurity experts warn about one of the largest credential compilations ever found, urging users to check "Have I Been Pwned" and change passwords immediately.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Young T. rex or a new dinosaur? New bones add to the debate
item.description: Scientists say there’s new evidence that settles the origins of a mysterious dinosaur excavated in the 1940s.
item.dc:creator: Adithi Ramakrishnan, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) — Don't be fooled by the fog machine, spooky lights and fake bats: the robotics lab at Worcester Polytechnic Institute lab isn't hosting a Halloween party.
item.dc:creator: HOLLY RAMER, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Universal Music Group and AI song generation platform Udio have settled a copyright infringement lawsuit and agreed to team up on new music creation and streaming platform, the two companies said in a joint announcement.
item.dc:creator: KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: AWS opens giant data center for AI training
item.description:
Just over a year after construction began, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has opened its giant data center near Lake Michigan in Indiana.
The data center, which is part of AWS Project Rainier, covers 1,200 acres, or 4.86 square kilometers.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Adobe AI assistants let you edit images in Photoshop and Express via prompts
item.description: Adobe is developing new generative AI (genAI) assistants that let users edit images in Adobe Express and Photoshop with written prompts. Having embedded AI-based content-generation tools across its apps in recent years, Adobe is rolling out AI assistants and agents.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Key principles of a successful internal developer platform
item.description: Modern software delivery is a story of increasing complexity. As organizations adopt cloud-native technologies, the number of tools, APIs, and processes keeps multiplying.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Windows 11: A guide to the updates
item.description: A Windows launch isn’t the end a process — it’s really just the beginning. Microsoft continually works on improving Windows 11 by fixing bugs, releasing security patches, and occasionally adding new features.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Meta shares slide after company projects higher expenses for 2026
item.description: Meta's stock slid in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the tech giant posted strong third-quarter results but warned that its expenses will be significantly higher in 2026 than this year. Like its rivals, Meta Platforms Inc.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Microsoft Azure outage takes Xbox, Minecraft and 365 products offline
item.description: Downdetector shows fewer reports of 365 product disruptions, but Minecraft and Xbox outage reports remain elevated.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Oler, NewsNation

item.title: Indiana executive order establishes drone task force
item.description: The task force is expected to develop a strategic plan for how Indiana can utilize its assets to help drone technology be developed across government, academia and industry.
item.dc:creator: David Gay, NewsNation

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: A new framework aims to build a bridge across the defense acquisition valley of death
item.description: "We're hacking the complexity of the defense acquisition system so America's technologists can focus on solving technology problems," said Keoki Jackson. The post A new framework aims to build a bridge across the defense acquisition valley of death first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gerton, Federal News Network
